casebody.data:
GOVIN v. DE MIRANDA et al. (Supreme Court, General Term, First Department. May 17, 1895.) Appeal from special term, New York county. Action by Luz Diaz Govin against Luciana Govin De Miranda and another. From an order denying the motion for bill of particulars, defendants appeal. Reversed.

Argued before VAN BRUNT, P. J., and O’BRIEN and FOLLETT, JJ.

Cephas Brainerd, for appellants. A. Kling, for respondent. PER CURIAM.

For the reasons stated in the opinion in Govin v. De Miranda (decided herewith) 33 N. Y. Supp. 753, the order appealed from should be reversed, with §10 costs and disbursements, and the motion granted, as therein stated.
